name: Chinese Ferret-Badger
description: A small, slender badger with a bushy tail, large ears, and a distinct dark facial pattern. Its back fur varies from chocolate brown to gray or cream.
spread_note: Assam to central China, Indomalayan region, Taiwan, Hainan
image_alt: Chinese Ferret-Badger, photo: Tomáš Adamec, Zoo Prague
proportions: Body length 20–30 cm, tail 15–23 cm, weight 1.5–2 kg
reproduction: Gestation period unknown, 1–3 young per litter
attractions: A solitary and nocturnal omnivore that forages on trees and ground for fruits, insects, and small vertebrates. Uses its strong claws to dig for worms and tubers. It has well-developed anal scent glands that spray at predators as a defense mechanism.
breeding: We have kept a pair of Chinese ferret-badgers since 2005.
